subject: RE: [junit] Test Dependencies
msgSnippet: We currently have much the same thing in testing our daos.  We do 3 tests in one method Write test data, Retrieve that data, delete that data.  That s 3
messageBody:
We currently have much the same thing in testing our daos. We do 3
"tests" in one method Write test data, Retrieve that data, delete that
data. That's 3 separate methods of the class that we are testing,
however, we do all three things in a single test method.

Robert Brown
Sinex Aviation Technologies

-----Original Message-----
From: Bryce Fischer [mailto:bryce@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 14, 2003 12:41 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Test Dependencies

I've got a fairly basic class (actually, its just a container for other
classes). This class needs to be serialized to a file and then reloaded
at
some point.



I'm using this as an opportunity to learn more about JUnit (since its
fairly
simple). My question is this



Given that I have two methods of my class I need to test, SaveLicense
and
LoadLicense, should I write this as two separate tests or as a single
test
that incorporates both? To clarify, to load a license, I would need to
have
a saved license. The load license would then verify that the information
that was saved was loaded correctly.
